timeline.message:
Deprecate AutowiredResourceInjector

Deprecate the AutowiredResourceInjector in favor of the
SimpleResourceInjector. Both implementation do exactly the same, with
the difference that the AutowiredResourceInjector can only be used with
the axon-test module

#894

Implement registerResourceInjector

Implement a registerResourceInjector. This should introduce a custom
ResourceInjector which is called along side the fixture's default
injector. Both should be called in this scenario to keep ensuring the
correct injection of default components like the CommandBus and EventBus
The custom version can in turn, if implemented as such, override the
default's injected resources

#894

Test registerResourceInjector

Add a test case which registers a custom resource injector. This should
validate that the custom injector is called once the first message is
passed through the fixture, as that will initialize a saga for testing
which includes resource injection.

#894

timeline.bodyText: Not sure I understand this. If the custom injector comes second, doesn't that give it the opportunity to override certain dependencies? If we want to force our own, the default injector should come last.

replies.bodyText:
My train of thought was to keep support for the registerResource(Object) and withTransienceCheckDisabled() methods workable, but allow the users to override the entirety of resource injections or to append to it.
To achieve both complete override and appending, I felt the custom implementation should come second.
